condition.description:
Blood pressure is the force of your blood pushing against the walls of your arteries. Each time your heart beats, it pumps blood into the arteries. Your blood pressure is highest when your heart beats, pumping the blood. This is called systolic pressure. When your heart is at rest, between beats, your blood pressure falls. This is called diastolic pressure.

Your blood pressure reading uses these two numbers. Usually the systolic number comes before or above the diastolic number. A reading of

  • 119/79 or lower is normal blood pressure
  • 140/90 or higher is high blood pressure
  • Between 120 and 139 for the top number, or between 80 and 89 for the bottom number is called prehypertension. Prehypertension means you may end up with high blood pressure, unless you take steps to prevent it.

High blood pressure usually has no symptoms, but it can cause serious problems such as stroke, heart failure, heart attack and kidney failure.

You can control high blood pressure through healthy lifestyle habits and taking medicines, if needed.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
condition.name: High blood pressure
symptoms: Usually has no symptoms but can cause stroke, heart failure, or heart attack

carousel_items: Quinapril works best over time, so even if you're feeling okay, be sure to take it at the same time everyday.
Try to avoid eating foods with a lot of salt.
If you're sitting or lying down, get up slowly to minimize dizziness.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Don’t stop taking Quinapril suddenly without asking your doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Quinapril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. By blocking a chemical that usually tightens blood vessels, it makes blood vessels relax. This lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Quinapril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function.
downsides: When you first start Quinapril, you can have a lower ability to taste things.
Some people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Need to get routine blood tests to see how this medicine is affecting your body.
Be sure to use contraception while taking this medication since it can cause harm to the fetus. It's also not safe to use if you're already pregnant.

upsides: In a clinical study, more than 65% of people using Quinapril were able to lower their blood pressure.
Quinapril lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
It protects your kidneys, so it's good for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Quinapril can cause birth defects or the death of a fetus. If you're pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Quinapril can cause birth defects or the death of a fetus. If you're pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime of using Quinapril. Seek immediate medical attention for any head/neck swelling or persistent abdominal pain.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime of using Quinapril. Seek immediate medical attention for any head/neck swelling or persistent abdominal pain.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Quinapril have excessive decreases in blood pressure. These people can also have decreased urination or kidney failure. If you're at risk of excessive drops in your blood pressure, be sure to follow up with your doctor. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change positions slowly.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Quinapril have excessive decreases in blood pressure. These people can also have decreased urination or kidney failure. If you're at risk of excessive drops in your blood pressure, be sure to follow up with your doctor. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change positions slowly.

risks_warnings.title: Liver failure
risks_warnings.description: In rare occasions, using ACE inhibitors like Quinapril can cause a blockage of bile, which leads to yellowing of the skin. This blockage can lead to sudden liver failure. People should stop taking Quinapril if they have yellowing of the skin or blood tests that show decreased liver function.

basics.benefits_moa: Aldactazide is a combination medicine that lowers your blood pressure with two diuretics (water pills), hydrochlorothiazide and spironolactone. They act on different parts of your kidney to get rid of extra fluids.
basics.bottom_line: Aldactazide removes excess fluid in your body and lowers your blood pressure, while helping keep your potassium levels safe.
downsides: Many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs blood tests to monitor electrolytes and kidney function.

basics.benefits_moa: Spironolactone is a potassium-sparing diuretic that blocks aldosterone (a hormone) and helps the kidney get rid of excess fluids in your body.
basics.bottom_line: Spironolactone is helpful when added to another diuretic to get rid of excess fluid in your body. Doesn't work well on its own.
downsides: Not very good at getting rid of excess fluids on its own. Should be used with another drug to help get rid of excess fluids.

basics.benefits_moa: Atenolol is a selective beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart and making it less work to pump.
basics.bottom_line: Atenolol is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack with fewer side effects than other beta blockers. You have to take it on an empty stomach, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: You have to take Atenolol on an empty stomach.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Atenolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people developing heart failure while taking Atenolol. If you notice swelling in your feet or ankles, or if your pulse feels fast or irregular, or shortness of breath when you lie down or during exercise, talk to your doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Azor is a combination of two medications that lower blood pressure, amlodipine (a calcium channel blocker) and olmesartan (an angiotensin receptor blocker). They both relax blood vessels in different ways, which causes blood pressure to go down.
basics.bottom_line: Azor is good for lowering blood pressure since it contains two medications that act in different ways to keep your pressure under control.
downsides: Only available in a fixed combination, so it's hard to change the doses of either medication on its own.
If you become pregnant, your doctor will need to change the medication since it can cause birth defects.
Even though Azor works well, it's usually not the first choice for treating high blood pressure since doctors often try other medications on their own before giving you two (in one pill) right away.
Can't be used with simvastatin (Zocor), a cholesterol lowering medication.
Only available as brand medication, so it can be somewhat pricey.

basics.benefits_moa: Bystolic is a selective beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart and making it work less to pump.
basics.bottom_line: Bystolic is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine for people with heart conditions, and has fewer side effects than other beta blockers, but it's expensive. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Not available in less expensive generic form.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Bystolic suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Bystolic suddenly can cause irregular fast heartbeat, high blood pressure, poor blood circulation to your heart and increase your risk of chest pain or heart attack. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Bystolic suddenly can cause irregular fast heartbeat, high blood pressure, poor blood circulation to your heart and increase your risk of chest pain or heart attack. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Beta-blocker medicines like Bystolic is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Bystolic has a lower chance of causing difficulty breathing, but should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood sugar unawareness
risks_warnings.description: Use of Bystolic can hide symptoms of low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), which can be life-threatening. If you have diabetes, be aware of other signs of low blood sugar, such as hunger, irritability, headache, sweating, and confusion.

basics.benefits_moa: Verapamil is a calcium channel blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing your heart rate and relaxing your blood vessels. Your heart gets more oxygen and doesn't have to work as hard to pump, which can relieve chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Verapamil works well to lower blood pressure and prevent chest pain, but you have to be okay with avoiding alcohol. You can't miss doses, and you might get persistent swelling.
downsides: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Verapamil than men.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Verapamil suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Not a good medication for you if you drink alcohol.

basics.benefits_moa: Captopril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Captopril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function, but you have to take it on an empty stomach.
downsides: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Compared to other ACE inhibitors, less flexible on when and how you take it. Captopril needs to be taken multiple times a day on an empty stomach.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Doxazosin is a selective alpha blocker. It relaxes the urethra and prostate, which makes it easier to urinate. It also lowers blood pressure by relaxing blood vessels.
basics.bottom_line: For men, Doxazosin will help make it easier to urinate so that you're not getting up a lot at night. It's a last-choice treatment for high blood pressure.
downsides: A last-choice treatment for high blood pressure because other medicines are more effective at preventing heart disease. Your doctor might add it to a medicine you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness or fainting may occur when taking Doxazosin when you change positions, such as going from a seated or lying down position to standing because of changes in your blood pressure, which may lead to falls. This is called orthostatic hypotension. Be very careful when changing positions, especially if you're just starting to take Doxazosin or if changes in dosing have to be made. Talk to your doctor if the dizziness doesn't go away or if you find it bothersome.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. It works in the brain to tell your blood vessels to relax, and it lowers the activity of certain stress hormones. This lowers blood pressure.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a good addition if you need more than one medicine to control your blood pressure, but it has a lot of side effects. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Has a lot of side effects compared to other blood pressure-lowering medicine because it works in the brain.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, or have a sudden rise of blood pressure that can result in complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the guidance of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

basics.benefits_moa: Carvedilol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Carvedilol is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: You have to take Carvedilol with food.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Worsened chest pain; increased risk of heart attack and heart rhythm problems
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly may start a heart attack or cause problems in your heartbeat rhythm. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly may start a heart attack or cause problems in your heartbeat rhythm. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing of the heart rate
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose.

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may experience a sudden decrease in your blood pressure, which may cause dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

description_processed.orig: You may experience a sudden decrease in your blood pressure, which may cause dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening heart failure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice worsening symptoms of heart failure if your prescriber decides to increase your dosage of Carvedilol. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as they may make changes to your medications for heart failure.

description_processed.orig: You may notice worsening symptoms of heart failure if your prescriber decides to increase your dosage of Carvedilol. risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Carvedilol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Carvedilol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Carvedilol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Carvedilol.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Carvedilol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Carvedilol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid

basics.benefits_moa: Diltiazem is a calcium channel blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing your heart rate and relaxing your blood vessels. Your heart gets more oxygen and doesn't have to work as hard to pump, which can relieve chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Diltiazem works well to lower blood pressure and prevent chest pain, but you have to be okay with avoiding alcohol. You can't miss doses, and you might get persistent swelling.
downsides: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Diltiazem than men.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Diltiazem suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Some brands of Diltiazem have to be taken with food, so listen carefully for instructions from your doctor or pharmacist.
Not a good medication for you if you drink alcohol.

downsides_processed.orig: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Diltiazem than men.

Calcium channel blockers work especially well for African Americans to lower blood pressure.
You can take it alone or with other medicines to help lower blood pressure.

Prevents heart-related chest pain (angina) if you take it regularly.
Treats certain abnormal heart rhythms.

basics.benefits_moa: Diovan HCT is a combination medicine. Valsartan (an angiotensin receptor blocker) lowers blood pressure by making blood vessels relax. Hydrochlorothiazide (a diuretic or water pill) lowers blood pressure and swelling by removing extra fluid from your body.
basics.bottom_line: Diovan HCT is a good 2-in-1 blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function like an ACE inhibitor, but with fewer side effects.
downsides: Comes in fixed dosage strengths, so it's harder for your doctor to adjust your dose.
Makes you urinate more often.
Doesn't work as well in people with severe kidney problems.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Comes in fixed dosage strengths, so it's harder for your doctor to adjust your dose.
Makes you urinate more often.
Doesn't work as well in people with severe kidney problems.

Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Combination medicine for people with high blood pressure. Doctors might prescribe it when you need more than one medicine to control your blood pressure.
The two drugs in Diovan HCT work together to lower blood pressure and remove extra water from your body.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Diovan HCT can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime of using Diovan HCT. Seek immediate medical attention for any head/neck swelling or persistent abdominal pain.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime of using Diovan HCT. Seek immediate medical attention for any head/neck swelling or persistent abdominal pain.

risks_warnings.title: Acute kidney failure
risks_warnings.description: Diovan HCT can cause kidney damage, especially if you already have a history of kidney disease. Talk to your doctor to discuss possible alternatives if this is a concern.

description_processed.orig: Diovan HCT can cause kidney damage, especially if you already have a history of kidney disease. Talk to your doctor to discuss possible alternatives if this is a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening lupus
risks_warnings.description: Diovan HCT can cause lupus or may make it worse. If you have a past history of lupus, talk to your doctor about the risks and benefits of taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased lithium in the body
risks_warnings.description: Diovan HCT may increase the levels of lithium if you are taking both. Talk to your doctor if you are taking lithium as they may have to adjust how much you take.

description_processed.orig: Diovan HCT may increase the levels of lithium if you are taking both. Talk to your doctor if you are taking lithium as they may have to adjust how much you take.

risks_warnings.title: Acute nearsightedness or glaucoma
risks_warnings.description: Diovan HCT may cause sudden nearsightedness or angle-closure glaucoma, especially if you have an allergy to penicillin or antibiotics with sulfonamides. This can lead to permanent blindness if not treated away. Tell your prescriber if you have these allergies, or if you suddenly develop sudden eye pain or changes in vision.

risks_warnings.title: Gout

downsides: Not the first choice to lower blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide suddenly can cause an irregular fast heartbeat, high blood pressure, poor blood circulation to your heart, and increase your risk of chest pain or heart attack. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose if you would like to stop taking Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can cause difficulty in breathing.

description_processed.orig: Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can cause difficulty in breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood sugar unawareness
risks_warnings.description: The beta blocker, metoprolol, in  Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide can hide symptoms of low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), which can be life-threatening. If you have diabetes, be aware of other signs of low blood sugar, such as hunger, irritability, headache, sweating, and confusion.

risks_warnings.title: Low heart rate (bradycardia)
risks_warnings.description: The beta blocker (metoprolol) in Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide can lower your heart rate too much. The dose might need to be changed by your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired, or getting out of breath doing things you normally can after using Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide for a week.

risks_warnings.title: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: The diuretic (hydrochlorothiazide) in Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low blood levels of sodium, potassium, or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles and other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Metoprolol succinate/Hydrochlorothiazide.

risks_warnings.title: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: Too much Hydrochlorothiazide can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, potassium or magnesium. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Inderide is a combination medicine that lowers your blood pressure with a diuretic (hydrochlorothiazide) and a beta blocker (propranolol). Hydrochlorothiazide removes extra water from your body and propranolol lowers your heart rate.
basics.bottom_line: Inderide is a good combination blood pressure-lowering medicine to try if your blood pressure is very high.
downsides: Can make you urinate more often and feel out of breath during physical activities.

Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you have diabetes.
Forgetting to take the medicine or stopping it suddenly can cause serious heart problems.
May not work as well if you have severe kidney problems.
Shouldn't take it if you have a sulfa allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Inderide has a beta blocker (propranolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Inderide has a lower chance of causing difficulty breathing, but should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood sugar unawareness
risks_warnings.description: The beta blocker, propranolol, in  Inderide can hide symptoms of low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), which can be life-threatening. If you have diabetes, be aware of other signs of low blood sugar, such as hunger, irritability, headache, sweating, and confusion.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD. It works in the brain and lowers the activity of certain stress hormones, but it's not a stimulant like many ADHD medicines.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a non-stimulant option to manage ADHD symptoms and behaviors, but it can lower your blood pressure.
downsides: Can lower blood pressure.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.

Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

basics.benefits_moa: Lopressor HCT is a combination medicine controls your blood pressure to reduce the risk of heart attack and stroke. The diuretic (hydrochlorothiazide) removes extra water from your body and the beta blocker (metoprolol) lowers your heart rate.
basics.bottom_line: Lopressor HCT is a good combination blood pressure-lowering medicine. It's used once other medicines haven't worked as well.
downsides: Since it has two medications in one, it's not the first choice to lower blood pressure.
It comes as a brand only medication, so it can be more expensive.
Can make you urinate more often and feel out of breath during physical activities.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're a diabetic.
Forgetting to take the medicine or stopping it suddenly can cause serious heart problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lopressor HCT suddenly can cause irregular fast heartbeat, high blood pressure, poor blood circulation to your heart and increase your risk of chest pain or heart attack. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose if you would like to stop taking Lopressor HCT.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Lopressor HCT suddenly can cause irregular fast heartbeat, high blood pressure, poor blood circulation to your heart and increase your risk of chest pain or heart attack. risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Lopressor HCT has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Lopressor HCT has a lower chance of causing difficulty breathing, but should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood sugar unawareness
risks_warnings.description: The beta blocker, metoprolol, in  Lopressor HCT can hide symptoms of low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), which can be life-threatening. If you have diabetes, be aware of other signs of low blood sugar, such as hunger, irritability, headache, sweating, and confusion.

risks_warnings.title: Low heart rate (bradycardia)
risks_warnings.description: The beta blocker (metoprolol) in Lopressor HCT can lower your heart rate too much. The dose might need to be changed by your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out of breath doing things you normally can do after using Lopressor HCT for a week.

description_processed.orig: The beta blocker (metoprolol) in Lopressor HCT can lower your heart rate too much. The dose might need to be changed by your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out of breath doing things you normally can do after using Lopressor HCT for a week.

risks_warnings.title: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: The diuretic (hydrochlorothiazide) in Lopressor HCT can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Lopressor HCT. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Metoprolol tartrate is a beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Metoprolol tartrate is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.

basics.benefits_moa: Losartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Losartan is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function like an ACE inhibitor, but with fewer side effects.
downsides: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Lotrel contains two medications that lower blood pressure. Amlodipine (a calcium channel blocker) causes your blood vessels to relax, and benazepril (an ACE inhibitor) blocks a chemical that tightens up your blood vessels. Your blood vessels being more relaxed causes your blood pressure to go down.
basics.bottom_line: Lotrel is good because it combines two first-line medications to lower blood pressure, and it's available in generic. However, it can cause throat irritation or a dry cough, and you can't stop it suddenly since it can cause your blood pressure to rise.
downsides: Can't be stopped suddenly because it can cause your blood pressure to bounce back very high.
Because it comes in fixed doses, it's hard to switch dosages if one medication isn't working as well as the other.
If you're pregnant or want to be pregnant, you'll have to be changed to another medication since Lotrel can cause birth defects.
In some people, benazepril, the ACE inhibitor, can cause throat irritation or a dry cough, and you can switch to another medication if it bothers you.
This is usually not given until you've tried at least one medication to lower your blood pressure and it hasn't worked.

The combination of these two medications work together to lower your blood pressure better than either by itself.

basics.benefits_moa: Psyllium is a fiber-based laxative. It adds bulk and moisture to your intestine, which softens stool and makes it easier to pass.
basics.bottom_line: The natural psyllium fiber in Psyllium does more than relieve constipation. It lowers cholesterol, keeps blood sugar levels healthy, and makes you feel less hungry between meals.
downsides: You may have to take Psyllium daily for 1-3 days to see full effects.
If you don't take it with enough liquid, it could swell, block your throat and cause choking.
Not the best choice for people who have swallowing problems or aren't able to drink lots of liquids.
Psyllium contains psyllium. Don't take if you have an allergy to psyllium from breathing it in or swallowing it.
Can cause gas and mild belly cramps.

basics.benefits_moa: Micardis is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). By blocking a chemical that usually tightens blood vessels, it makes blood vessels relax. This lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Micardis is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function just like ACE inhibitors, but has fewer side effects.
downsides: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

Works similar to ACE inhibitors (like lisinopril), but doesn't have the same side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for people with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling

carousel_items: Minoxidil works best over time, so even if you're feeling okay, be sure to take it at the same time everyday.
You can take Minoxidil with or without food.
Avoid activities that need you to be fully alert like driving, until you know how Minoxidil affects you.
If you're sitting or lying down, get up slowly to minimize dizziness.
Be sure to have your blood pressure and heart rate checked often while taking Minoxidil.
Talk to your doctor before taking medications that can raise your blood pressure, like cough or cold medications, diet pills, stimulants, ibuprofen, and some natural products.

basics.benefits_moa: Minoxidil is a vasodilator. It helps lower blood pressure by relaxing and opening the blood vessels in your arms, legs, and organs.
basics.bottom_line: Minoxidil should only be used to treat blood pressure when other medications can’t.
downsides: You'll need to take a diuretic or “water pill” to get rid of the salt and water your body hangs onto when taking Minoxidil.
You'll also need to take a heart medication like a beta-blocker to slow your heart from beating too fast.
In some people, Minoxidil can cause chest pain, heart attack, or heart failure.
It can take a few weeks after starting Minoxidil before you feel the full benefits.

risks_warnings.title: Complicated treatment
risks_warnings.description: Minoxidil should only be taken under the supervision of a physician. In addition to Minoxidil, a beta-blocker should be used taken to decrease the chances of tachycardia (fast heart rate). Most doctors also prescribe a loop diuretic with Minoxidil to prevent salt and water retention.

risks_warnings.title: Serious heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Minoxidil is a very strong blood pressure medication. It can have serious side effects including pericardial effusion (too much fluid building up around the heart). This can lead to cardiac tamponade (pressure on the heart from a fluid build up).

description_processed.orig: Minoxidil is a very strong blood pressure medication. It can have serious side effects including pericardial effusion (too much fluid building up around the heart). This can lead to cardiac tamponade (pressure on the heart from a fluid build up).

risks_warnings.title: Salt and water retention
risks_warnings.description: Taking Minoxidil can lead to salt and water build up in your legs, ankles, feet, and sometime arms and hands. Because of this, a loop diuretic or “water pill” should be taken in addition to Minoxidil. Without a loop diuretic, Minoxidil can cause congestive heart failure (a condition where the heart doesn’t pump blood well).

risks_warnings.title: Blood pressure control
risks_warnings.description: In people with very high blood pressure, Minoxidil can decrease blood pressure too quickly. This can lead to syncope (a temporary loss of consciousness), stroke, heart attack, and loss of vision or hearing. In patients with serious hypertension, Minoxidil should be started at a hospital.

basics.benefits_moa: Nifedipine is a calcium channel blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing your heart rate and relaxing your blood vessels. Your heart gets more oxygen and doesn't have to work as hard to pump, which can relieve chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Nifedipine works well to lower blood pressure and prevent chest pain, but you have to be okay with avoiding grapefruit. You can't miss doses, and you might get persistent swelling.
downsides: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Nifedipine than men.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Nifedipine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Not a good medication for you if you love grapefruit. It can make Nifedipine have a stronger effect on your blood pressure.

basics.benefits_moa: Amlodipine is a calcium channel blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing your heart rate and relaxing your blood vessels. Your heart gets more oxygen and doesn't have to work as hard to pump, which can relieve chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Amlodipine works well to lower blood pressure and prevent chest pain. You can't miss doses, and you might get persistent swelling.
downsides: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Amlodipine than men.
Some people might experience flushing with this medication.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Amlodipine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
If you have severe heart disease, using Amlodipine might increase your risk of chest pain or heart attack during the time right after starting the medication or raising the dosage.
Might not be a good choice if you have liver disease.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You can experience dizziness due to a drop in blood pressure.  This is a common early side effect of many medications that lower blood pressure including Amlodipine.  Typically this will go away over time as your body gets used to the lowered blood pressure. It may be more likely to occur when you change posture, such as going from sitting to standing.  If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly.  If the dizziness is unbearable then talk with your doctor.  A different medication may be better for you.

If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly.  If the dizziness is unbearable then talk with your doctor.  A different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Worsening heart pain or increased risk of heart attack is possible when you first start taking Amlodipine.  This can also happen after you increase the dose of Amlodipine. Notify your doctor immediately if you experience any heart pain, radiating jaw pain, crushing chest pain, or persistent racing heartbeat.

Notify your doctor immediately if you experience any heart pain, radiating jaw pain, crushing chest pain, or persistent racing heartbeat.

risks_warnings.title: Special dosing requirements
risks_warnings.description: Your body uses your liver to break down Amlodipine and remove it from your blood. If you have liver disease you may not be able to remove Amlodipine as quickly from your blood as someone with a healthy liver. You should increase the dose of Amlodipine slowly and watch closely for how it is working in your body.  Increasing the dose slowly will lower your chances of having side effects.

description_processed.orig: Your body uses your liver to break down Amlodipine and remove it from your blood. You should increase the dose of Amlodipine slowly and watch closely for how it is working in your body.  Increasing the dose slowly will lower your chances of having side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Foot and leg swelling (edema)
risks_warnings.description: Amlodipine can cause varying degrees of swelling in your limbs. The most commonly affected areas are your feet, ankles, legs, or occasionally your arms. Swelling may be worse if you have other conditions that makes it hard for your body to get rid of fluids such as congestive heart failure or kidney disease. If your swelling is caused by Amlodipine, it should improve when you stop taking the medication. If the swelling is bothersome, a different medication may be better for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Prazosin is a selective alpha blocker. It lowers blood pressure by relaxing blood vessels. It also relaxes the urethra and prostate, which makes it easier to urinate.
basics.bottom_line: Prazosin is used mostly to make urination easier for men with an enlarged prostate, but it can cause dizziness.
downsides: Not the best medicine to lower blood pressure by itself.
Likely to cause orthostatic hypotension. This means dizziness when you change positions (like standing up) because your blood pressure doesn't adjust quickly enough.
Not preferred for people 65 years or older.

basics.benefits_moa: Propranolol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Propranolol is good for treating many heart problems and other problems in the body, but it has more side effects than other beta blockers. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

basics.benefits_moa: Lisinopril/hydrochlorothiazide is a combination medicine. Lisinopril (an ACE inhibitor) lowers blood pressure by making blood vessels relax. Hydrochlorothiazide (a diuretic or water pill) lowers blood pressure and swelling by removing extra fluid from your body.
basics.bottom_line: Lisinopril/hydrochlorothiazide is a good 2-in-1 blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function.
downsides: Comes in fixed dosage strengths, so it's harder for your doctor to adjust your dose.
Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Makes you urinate more often.
Doesn't work as well in people with severe kidney problems.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Combination medicine for people with high blood pressure. Doctors might prescribe it when you need more than one medicine to control your blood pressure.
The two drugs in Lisinopril/hydrochlorothiazide work together to lower blood pressure, remove extra water from your body, and lower your risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.
